column1: San Marcos ( SAN MAR-kəs) is a city and the county seat of Hays County
column3: United States. The city's limits extend into Caldwell and Guadalupe Counties

column1: Many residents of San Marcos support the athletic programs of the Texas State University known as the Texas State Bobcats. The football program won the NCAA Division II National Championships in 1982 and 1983 and now competes in the NCAA Division I (FBS) Sun Belt Conference. The Texas State Bobcats play home games in Bobcat Stadium
column3: 000 fans. Basketball and Volleyball games are played at Strahan Arena. Baseball games are played at Bobcat Ballpark.

The City of San Marcos and the San Marcos Arts Commission broke ground in January 2013 on a commemorative sculpture that will sit at the intersection of LBJ Drive and MLK Drive. Designed by Aaron P. Hussey
column2: it depicts Johnson and King conversing in the Oval Office. It was officially unveiled on Martin Luther King Jr. Day in 2014.The downtown area has become home to several graffiti-style murals

column6: culture and natural beauty of the city.

column1: Archeologists have found evidence at the San Marcos River associated with the Clovis culture
column2: which suggests that the river has been the site of human habitation for more than 10
column3: 000 years.  The San Marcos Springs are the third-largest collection of springs in Texas. Never in recorded history has the river run dry.

column2: Spaniard Alonso de Leon led an expedition from Mexico to explore Texas and establish missions and presidios in the region. De Leon's party helped blaze the Camino Real (later known as the Old San Antonio Road)
column3: which followed present-day Hunter Road
column4: Hopkins Street
column5: and Aquarena Springs Drive (the route later shifted four miles to the south; it is now followed by County Road 266
column6: known locally as Old Bastrop Highway). De Leon's party reached the river on April 25
column7: the feast day of St. Mark the Evangelist; the river was thus named the San Marcos.In January 1808
column8: a small group of Mexican families settled at the Old Bastrop Highway crossing of the river
column9: and named the settlement Villa de San Marcos de Neve. The settlers were plagued by floods and Indian raids
column10: and the settlement was abandoned in 1812.In November 1846
column11: the first Anglos settled in the vicinity of the San Marcos Springs. The Texas Legislature organized Hays County on March 1
column13: and designated San Marcos as the county seat. In 1851
column14: a town center was laid out about a mile southwest of the headwaters of the river. The town became a center for ginning and milling local agricultural products. The town's most notable founder and early settler was Gen. Edward Burleson
column15: a hero of the Texas Revolution and former vice president of the Republic of Texas. Burleson built a dam on the upper reaches of the river in 1849. The dam powered several mills
column16: including one within present-day Sewell Park.
